p: The usage of S. scardica in traditional and modern medicine has demonstrated various degrees of effectiveness with promising beneficial health results in a long series of pathologies from prevention of anemia, anxiety disorders, major depression, cardiovascular disease, attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder, mental impairment, or neurodegenerative diseases [ 77] to rheumatic problems [ 94], inflammatory pain, gastric ulcer [ 93], pulmonary pathologies (common cold, lung emphysema, bronchitis, and asthma) [ 85], and also an effective cytotoxic activity [ 92, 95]. The anti-inflammatory and edema-reducing capabilities should be considered as the basis for further studies of S. scardica implication in pain modulation.
